common_issues.title: Pieces Feature Requests and Installation Issues
common_issues.description: Users report issues with feature requests, such as adding new languages, and installation problems related to Pieces OS and external tools. Solutions involve internal development efforts, bug fixes, and improved communication on updates and workarounds.

related_issues.title: Adding a script language to the supported languages
related_issues.text:
Adding a script language to the supported languages ### Discussed in https://github.com/pieces-app/support/discussions/1
Originally posted by **ddasberg** January 21, 2025 Is it possible to add a script language to the supported languages? If so, what kind of files or information are necessary? We have develeoped a script-language for database-applications for Windows named "CARA". Our complete Windows-ERP-System has been written in CARA. It would be nice to have Pieces-support for the language.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation **Key points raised:** * User @ddasberg reported an issue with feature request. * The issue was automatically triaged and routed to the proper Pieces team member. **Problems identified:** * Feature request not implemented yet. **Solutions proposed/implemented:** * Support bot provided helpful resources for the user. * @mark-at-pieces confirmed adding the feature request to internal language support. **Current status/outcome:** * Feature request under review by the Pieces team. * User awaiting further updates.

related_issues.title: Copilot is not giving any feedback
related_issues.text:
Copilot is not giving any feedback
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

Pieces for Developers 3.3.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

The copilot is not generating anything, it just keeps on loading.
## GitHub Issue Summary: Copilot Processing Error

**Key Points:**

* @gittydia reported an issue where the Copilot feature throws a "Something went wrong with the processing" error.
* The issue was automatically triaged and routed to the support team.
* Related issues were suggested for reference.
* @mark-at-pieces mentioned a fix arriving in PiecesOS 11.0.4, scheduled for release no later than Thursday (Jan 14th).
* @luigigalli confirmed the same issue on MacOs with specific versions.

**Problems Identified:**

* Copilot fails to process requests due to an internal error.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* A fix is implemented and scheduled for release in PiecesOS 11.0.4

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The fix is pending release in PiecesOS 11.0.4, expected on or before Thursday, January 14th.
* Users are advised to report back after the update if the issue persists.

related_issues.title: Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
related_issues.text:
Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

User reports immediate "Ollama failed to install" diaglog upon clicking install Ollama install button in Pieces desktop app
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points:**

* Pieces' automated support bot triaged the issue and suggested resources.
* User 'ekuznetsov139' reported "Ollama failed to install" error despite having curl installed.
* The issue was identified as Pieces being installed as a snap, preventing access to executables outside its sandbox.

**Problems Identified:**

* Pieces incorrectly assumed curl was universally installed.
* Pieces was unable to access manually installed Ollama due to the snap sandbox.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* User suggested adding curl to Pieces' snap dependency packages.
* Pieces acknowledged the issue and confirmed they were working on a patch to access Ollama from the sandbox.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* As of Jan 23, 2025, the issue persists in the latest Pieces snap version.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation demonstrates effective communication between user and support team, with clear explanations and updates. 
* The issue appears to be a configuration problem with Pieces' snap confinement, rather than a user-side error.

common_issues.title: Copilot Processing Error and Download Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues with Copilot, including processing errors and download failures.  Solutions include updating to the latest Pieces OS version (11.0.4), checking API keys, and switching to alternative language models.  Support is actively investigating the issues and requesting logs for further analysis.

related_issues.title: Copilot Bug: 'I'm sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please...' copilot response
related_issues.text:
Copilot Bug: 'I'm sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please...' copilot response
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

hi i have been using it for 2 days but for the last 2 hours the desktop and visual studio extension are not working. 

No matter what I type, it gives me this error. There was an update message for the app, it was about installing a version, I installed it but it didn't fix it.
always the same message 
visual studio ide 2022 17.12 
windows 10 pro
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c64d85bd-eb1a-4f1c-a25e-570c9a55ccd1)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/55b600a6-95f4-4e71-aee1-1b1ce8b6599c)


## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points Raised:**

* Users reported an error message: "I'm sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please wait a few seconds and try again."
* Several users confirmed encountering the issue.

**Problems Identified:**

* The issue was associated with Claude and Gemini language models. 
* Removing the OpenAI API key resolved the issue for some users.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Switching to the GPT4o language model was suggested as a temporary fix.
* Updating to Pieces version 11.0.3 and ensuring users are signed in were also recommended.
* Investigating the root cause of the problem with Claude and Gemini was ongoing.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue persisted for some users even after the proposed solutions. 
* Real-time debugging was offered to further investigate individual cases.

**Additional Notes:**

* Registering OpenAI API keys was temporarily discouraged due to potential connection issues. 
* It was unclear when the issue with Claude and Gemini would be fully resolved.

related_issues.title: Unable to open Pieces Copilot Service
related_issues.text:
Unable to open Pieces Copilot Service
Error: HttpException: Connection closed before full header was received, uri = http://127.0.0.1:39300/model/2fca5f65-b3ce-459b-b394-0ea5de0b050d/download/progress

**Installation Details**

Succeeded: true
Path: C:\Program Files\WindowsApps\com.MeshIntelligentTechnologi.PiecesOS_11.0.4.0_x64__84gz00a5z79wr/os_server.exe

**PiecesOS Information**

ID: 62ded9e8-d9d0-490e-b34e-632516b3cf1a

User: Anonymous
Current Version: 11.0.4
Min Version Supported: 11.0.4
Max Version Supported: 12.0.0
Local Port: 39300

**Device Information**

Operating System: Windows
Current Version: "Windows 10 Home Single Language" 10.0 (Build 26100)
Min Version Supported: Windows 10 Build 1903
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* User @AmanSingh766 reported an issue with downloading local LLMs in Pieces.
* The issue involves an exception: "Connection closed before full header was received."
* Support bot suggested similar issues and resources for reference.
* @mark-at-pieces requested support logs and clarification on download behavior.

**Problems Identified:**

* User is unable to download local LLMs.
* The root cause of the connection error is unclear.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Provide support logs for analysis.
* Clarify if the error occurs consistently or only occasionally.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is being investigated by @mark-at-pieces.
* A resolution is pending further information and analysis. 

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation took place on January 18th and 20th, 2025. 
* The latest update was provided by @mark-at-pieces on January 20th.

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop App Installation and Launch Issues
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces Desktop App installation and launch errors across Linux and Windows. Problems include snap confinement conflicts on Linux and cryptic error messages on Windows. Proposed solutions involve dependency management for snap and detailed log analysis for Windows issues.

related_issues.title: Non-dismissable overlay message.
related_issues.text:
Non-dismissable overlay message.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces app launches at Windows startup (intended). Sometimes, (possibly after a background update?), this dialog appears on my desktop. I don't know what it means, exactly, but I cannot click "Ok" and there is no other way to dismiss it. My only option appears to be to restart the computer, which is often impractical. Please fix!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f231ef56-3d59-4e94-8cb5-2b54249900cc)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: "Unable to Launch Pieces Windows Desktop"

**Key Points:**

* User `ThemePark` reported an issue where they were unable to launch the Pieces Windows Desktop app.
* The Pieces support bot triaged the issue and suggested relevant resources.
* Pieces team member `mack-at-pieces` requested additional information such as Windows version and installed software versions.

**Problems Identified:**

* User is unable to launch the Pieces Windows Desktop app.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Gathering user information to diagnose the issue.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is currently being investigated. 

**Additional Information:**

* The user has not yet provided the requested information.

**Next Steps:**

* User should provide details about their Windows version and installed software versions.

recommendations: Investigate and address the root cause of Copilot processing errors and download failures, including checking API keys and language model compatibility.
Provide clearer documentation and communication to users regarding Pieces OS updates, workarounds, and feature requests.
Review and improve the Pieces Desktop App installation process on Linux, particularly addressing snap confinement conflicts and dependency management.
Investigate and resolve the cryptic error messages during Pieces Desktop App launch on Windows, potentially through detailed log analysis.
Prioritize resolving the issue of non-dismissable overlay messages on Windows and ensure future updates do not introduce similar issues.
Consider adding a script language to the supported languages based on user feedback and demand.
Continue monitoring and addressing issues related to Ollama installation on Linux, ensuring compatibility with Pieces OS and its dependencies.
Gather more detailed logs and information from users experiencing Copilot issues to aid in debugging and resolution.
Provide regular updates to users on the status of reported issues, especially for high-impact problems like Copilot errors.
Consider implementing a more robust error handling and reporting mechanism in the Pieces Desktop App to provide clearer information to users and developers.
Review and update support resources, such as FAQs and troubleshooting guides, to address common issues and questions raised by users.
Explore options for improving communication and collaboration between the support team and development team to expedite issue resolution.
Analyze support ticket trends over time to identify recurring problems and areas for improvement in the product or support processes.
Collect user feedback on the support experience and identify areas for improvement in responsiveness, communication, and issue resolution.
